alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Walworth (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Edmunds, central Dewey, southwestern McPherson and Walworth Counties through 415 PM CDT/315 PM MDT/... At 320 PM CDT/220 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Eureka to near Selby to 6 miles east of White Horse to near Parade. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Selby and Lake Hiddenwood Rec Area around 325 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hillsview, Akaska, Laplant, Tiospaye Topa School, Ridgeview, Hosmer and Lowry. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Aberdeen.
